definition: (of a surgeon) to perform an operation/(of a patient) to have an operation/to decapitate/to behead/to single out as a point of attack

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: Worried your employer might cut your position in a downturn?
sentences.chinese: 擔心在不景氣的時候第一個被拿來開刀嗎？

sentences.english: She had been operated on cholecystitis.
Patients tend to recover more quickly from such procedures than they would going under the knife.
sentences.chinese: 與開刀手術相比，接受此類手術的患者恢復速度更快。

sentences.english: I don't have a scar because the doctors operated on me with a laser.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有留疤的原因是因爲醫生是用雷射幫我開刀的。

sentences.english: Since he had a heart attack, he protected his chest area.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他是心臟開刀，所以他就報護胸前。

sentences.english: All four governors have caused a stir by taking on public-sector unions.
sentences.chinese: 四位州長都曾因拿政府公共部門工會開刀而引起風波。

sentences.english: Doctors give Trasylol to patients before surgery to reduce the risks of blood loss.
sentences.chinese: 醫生在開刀前給患者使用該藥來減少出血的風險。

sentences.english: This is the ultimate in one-hand openers.
sentences.chinese: 這是單手開刀的終極解決方案。

sentences.english: Intrahepatic bile duct stones have surgery surgery?
sentences.chinese: 肝內膽管結石必須開刀手術嗎？

sentences.english: How's Sharon since her surgery last month?
sentences.chinese: 莎朗上個月開刀之後的狀況怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Nobody will be laying off star salespeople.
sentences.chinese: 不會有人拿星級的營銷員開刀的。

sentences.english: I'm used to it now. If only don't approved Peihua's operation.
sentences.chinese: 已經成了習慣了，當初我不答應給佩華開刀就好了。

definition: to recur (of a disease)/to reappear/to relapse (into a former bad state)
to make a definite diagnosis/confirmed (case of a specific disease)
